page.title: 19Changes In The Deverills
page.content: This is an historical area,which has been continuously inhabited for 5000 years.{Cold Kitchen Hill}with its ancient trackways,ditch systems and long barrow shows evidence of man's occupation from earliest times. The area also has a strong tradition of folk-lore associated with{King {Alfred.}Throughout this long history man has left his mark on the land-scape but it remains essentially rural.In recent years in-filling of 'Executive-style' new houses has occurred in Longbridge. Dutch Elm disease had a great effect on the landscape when trees disappeared from the hedge-rows.Hedges have been grubbed out to create larger more efficient fields and improve crop yields.The busy A350 has increased in traffic but once thro'Longbridge it leaves the valley to its ancient peace
